website_summaries.verdict: If you prefer a metal spatula with a long handle for light, simple cooking tasks, it's worth considering.
pros: Thin enough to slide easily under food
Owners love how well it works with cast iron and stainless steel pans
cons: Feels like it could bend if used for serious scraping
Not for use with non-stick cookware
The handle feels cheap to some users

customer_reviews.title: It is a thick rounded end that is useless and does not get under anything--a pancake
customer_reviews.text: The edge on the spatula front is not an edge. It is a thick rounded end that is useless and does not get under anything--a pancake, for example.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade is Too Thick
customer_reviews.text: More of a food pusher than a food turner. Can't get under the food without holding it because the blade is too thick/not tapered at the edges. Maybe okay for grill. Used it once and put it in the garbage instead of the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Bart in Ft. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great turner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased cast iron pans recently and needed something to use in them. All I had was plastic turners and they don't work well in cast iron and can sometimes melt a bit in them. This turner is nice and lightweight and is thin enough to turn your food without tearing it up. It scrapes the pans nicely when food sticks a bit and it has held up well. I have not noticed any chipping or wearing from cooking. I will be buying a few more of these since one just isn't enough.
customer_reviews.author: scrumpage

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Just exactly what I wanted / needed. The blade is thin enough to slide easily under delicate food. And the turner is very well made indeed, I see little that is likely to fail. There is no weld point between the blade and the handle, the most likely point of failure. That's what did in my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Shari A. Mann

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an ok low budget spatula. The blade end has a slight angle to it that I don't much care for. I'd prefer a straight blade end. However my biggest dislike is the thickness of the blade that prevents it from sliding easily under food, i.e. turning a fried egg. The overall length and handle angle to the blade is good. Again for the money I think it's worth holding on to.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Thin Yet Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Thin enough to get under the fragile-est of pancakes, yet sturdy enough to flip a steak. Lightweight and durable. The handle is not too bulky either (my old spatula had a super thick handle and it didn't fit in my utensil holder). this one is great!
customer_reviews.author: EcoGal

customer_reviews.title: Love the flat head
customer_reviews.text: I searched real hard to find a turner that didn't have a round or slanted head. Why do they make the rounded ones anyway? The last one I had was tack welded between the handle and the turning plate which broke apart. These are all one piece and the handles are sturdy and comfortable to hold. Its a best buy.
customer_reviews.author: Angeles E Oakes

customer_reviews.title: It’s exactly  would expect, although maybe a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good flipper, I guess. Not much to it, really. I use to flip stuff, but it’s also good to scrape the brown bits off of the bottom of my pan when deglazing. The only thing is that it’s a tad bit flimsy, so don’t use it to squish down on anything too hard or it will bend out of place.
customer_reviews.author: Kosmo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, thin sheet metal
customer_reviews.text: Very thin sheet metal. Bends her easy. Cheaply made. Even handles are just a very cheap looking plastic. Much worse quality than I was expecting. What they don't show you in the pic is under the handles. The edges had to folded over for added strength otherwise, its as thin as a sheet of paper! Those folded edges are not at all comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: IamKrusty

customer_reviews.title: Chef Craft 12510, Turner (1-Pack), Silver
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made. If you apply any pressure by mashing down on frying food the handle on this thing will bend. I would never recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Randy225

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron's soulmate!
customer_reviews.text: I am switching to Cast iron pan, skillets and griddles and noticed that silicon/nylon spatulas/turners were not going very well with them. Got this one as trial and man this cheap priced item is Perfecto!!! Light, comfortable with grip, and does great job scraping from cast iron pans bottom which nylon spatulas can't do. It's arm is not too long so it sits perfect in my 8" frying pan. Couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: This is a steal! Great quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: I was casually browsing through my past Amazon purchases, and then saw this product and was re-surprised at the price as the quality! This spatula is something I purchased 1.5 years ago, still use today, and is still is amazing condition after several uses. For being a sturdy metal spatula that is priced under $6, I have to say I'm impressed and very happy that I made this purchase looking back. Given the very straightforward usages for a spatula, I do not advise purchasing a more expensive option. If you buy this, you will be very happy that you did not spend more! Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Really big
customer_reviews.text: These things are HUGE! They barely fit in my kitchen drawer. But I guess more surface area helps when trying to cook. I love all of the different utensils you get for the price. They seem to be high quality, and I haven’t had a problem with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh

customer_reviews.title: Works as it's supposed to and very inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: While the slotted spoon is lighter weight than I expected, it works exactly as it's supposed to work. The price I paid was so low that I cannot complain about that at all. It appears to be sheet metal cut and shaped, but I don't know for sure how it's manufactured. I got this so we could get beans and bay leaves out of the InstantPot when we cook beans in it. It works as it's supposed to. I've only had it for about ten days so cannot speak to it's longterm durability.
customer_reviews.author: SuperMomHikerGirl

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I received this the first week of March 2020 and have been using it dailey to cook with in my iron skillets. It works wonderfully for getting under all items to flip them as well as scraping the fond tidbits from the pan when I want to deglaze it with meats that are cooked. Truly perfect with it’s straight edge tip for steaks and chicken breast. It’s sturdy and dishwasher safe. No rust or pitting. Or flimsy bowing. I can’t believe it was just a little under $5 for the quality that it’s made of. Very happy with my new spatula!
customer_reviews.author: D. Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Use with stainless steel pans/skillets - Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and stainless steel scrubbers for my mother so she can start cooking with her stainless steel pans. We have been doing so for years and explained how to do did it (heat pan first, add cooking spray or oil, then food). Most times, nothing sticks, but whatever residue does, can be scrubbed off with the scrubbers. My mother is extremely happy with her pans now. The right tools make all the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Howland

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Suffice It to say there's a reason it's so unusually inexpensive. Warped and bent after two uses and washings (by hand). Very cheap and light feeling, bends easily. Just don't.
customer_reviews.author: ralph g. clark

customer_reviews.title: Chef Craft Select Stainless Steel Turner
customer_reviews.text: Chef Craft Select Stainless Steel Turner is a bit thinner than I thought. Cheaply made but that's why it was cheap and came in pairs. Product works great as I feel like it's something I would get back in college. Not recommended if you are looking for something nice. The handle is hard and the frame is thin but it does the job and it's stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Something you can buy at the dollar store! I only bought it online since I’m stuck at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I threw it away
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I just put in the recycling... flimsy and can’t actually get under food
customer_reviews.author: waffle pants

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made in China
customer_reviews.text: Looks cheap. Its made in china i guess when its cheap is made in china. Now i am Doubting what kind of material they used? With China you cant trust! Specially food or things you use for food! I hope with heat they dont release a bad chemical for my body! China will use anything to make products! They really dont regulate anything!
customer_reviews.author: Christy V

customer_reviews.title: Eh, It's Okay. Does What It Should.
customer_reviews.text: This is okay, I'm pretty sure you can get the same one at your local dollar store for way less. Not very durable, overall good sturdiness - i suggest shopping around for a better one that will last long. It is easy to clean and have had no issues putting it in the dishwasher (have probably used 4 or 5 times now since buying).
customer_reviews.author: Weston & Lacey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Stamped Turner
customer_reviews.text: Cheap stamped Turner I tried to see if it would flex and it bent I'd give it a 2 1/2 Stars if I could when trying to turn eggs when trying to flip eggs it pushes the eggs instead of getting under it to flip it
customer_reviews.author: Dale Hamon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap. They bend trying to flip food. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Awful! Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This was awful! I started cooking and gray stuff started showing up all over the food, the metal or metal type finish was coming off into my food :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable turner for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: The turner is flexible, with a solid comfortable handle. I use it to flip grilled sandwiches, when making pancakes or when frying eggs. I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Em

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and will not melt
customer_reviews.text: This metal spatula is an inexpensive and very functional tool to use with my favorite fry pan made of cast iron. The high heat from my gas stove melted slightly the non metal spatulas. With this item I know I am not getting chemical residue in my food.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: i can turn a pancake, flip a tortilla or an egg, and they will do the job without tearing everything up. They are more than some others out there, but do the job. However, buying the 2 pack is still cheaper than the plastic junk the stores only carry anymore. That's why I know these will last, metal is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set - works well - look nice, too
customer_reviews.text: We are swapping plastic utensils out of our kitchen and this set helped us cover many of the ones we use the most. We have used them with a variety of dishes since we got them. They all have worked well. We really like the spatula and the dipper.
customer_reviews.author: WileEC

customer_reviews.title: too much angle
customer_reviews.text: The angle of the blade is about 45 degrees. I'm used to spatulas with about half that. As a result I need to lift my elbow higher than I am comfortable with. Otherwise it's a fine tool. This angle is something that should be in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made but for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Super cheap feeling and not incredibly strong or well made, but I knew I would get what I paid for when I bought it. I got it for our camper, and chances are I’ll lose it soon anyways so why pay a lot. Dang cheap but you get what you pay for so it’s fine with me.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Lee Beals Ketelsen

customer_reviews.title: The blade is not too thick like others say
customer_reviews.text: The blade is not too thick like others say. I'm a home chef and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality for the price. If you have even the littlest amount of kitchen skills, you will be fine with this product. In fact, I am ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Parent

customer_reviews.title: It's alright.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but am a bit disappointed in how flimsy this is. Feels like I'd break this from too much pressure pressing down on burger patties or flattening anything against my pan. Cleans easy enough though and has a decent grip on it until you press on it then at that point it's annoying.
customer_reviews.author: FallenRangerz

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my stainless steel pans. I wish it was a little slimmer at the tip for getting under the eggs, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Size not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: These look lovely, but I bought them specifically to replace some older decrepit SMALL spatulas. They were advertised as being 8.5 inches and are, in fact, much larger, full-sized. I have not used them yet, because I already have several that are fine, so I can't speak to their usability.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Wurst

customer_reviews.title: This one is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced one I'd used for the past 60 years and has the angle and size I was use too. Most everything available has huge handles, odd shapes and doesn't fit well in limited drawer space. This one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth

customer_reviews.title: Good strong spatula/turner.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this didn't appear as strong as I had hoped when it first arrived, but since then have been pleasantly surprised. It is quite strong and does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Webfoot

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Doubt it will hol up to regular us.
customer_reviews.author: marilou martin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this spatula. The metal is thick enough to not bend or be floppy, yet it's thin & works great in all my pans! I can see this being the last spatula I ever buy!
customer_reviews.author: MrsAH

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful Using This
customer_reviews.text: This spatula could be very nice except for one thing. The back of the handle has two sharp edges and will cut your hand. I don't understand why it's made this way but it's dangerous to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I got tired of my flimsy plastic spatulas, so I got this. I love it. It's super sturdy, easily can go under food to flip them. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed a truly flat-edged spatula, and this works!
customer_reviews.text: Truly flat-edged, great for scraping the bottom of a pot or skillet when you're trying to achieve a "perfect burn" on something. Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: old_MK

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great for cooking and getting under food that you *may* have let cook too long on one side because you were loading the dishwasher or mopping the floor and forgot about dinner 🤷🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Good except the handle
customer_reviews.text: It works great, thin enough to get under stuff, nice and broad so it's easy to flip things. My only complaint is that the plastic handle will melt if you let it touch a hot surface like the edge of a skillet. Not a huge deal, but a bit annoying to melt the handle if you forget and set it down wrong.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Strong and good quality Spatula.
customer_reviews.text: This a very good quality spatula. Love using it. It is very strong. I use it in a daily basis in my kitchen, when cooking. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't feel right
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for 3 weeks now and it didn't break or peel but something feels wrong. It is not sturdy enough and feels cheap. It is not bad for this price though but if you are looking for something nice this is not the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: eylem

customer_reviews.title: Great Spatula!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is perfect for cooking! I love that it's sturdy and strong. I had to replace an old ikea plastic spatula that clearly broke, and this one is great compared to that one! I used it for pancakes, eggs, grilled cheese sandwiches, etc and it's great! I love it and definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: Good quality turner.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stainless steel turner. Asking price is affordable and quality matched the price. Not sure how long turner will last but I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S B

customer_reviews.title: I like the shorter length for my smaller grills.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shorter length - use them with my Weber Q2200 portable grill. Don't need those looooong turners I see in the local big box stores for my smaller grills. Being short(er) also means I can get the top on the plastic bucket I use to store my BBQ tools in.
customer_reviews.author: basicblur

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra $3 for OXO
customer_reviews.text: This spatula is not sturdy enough for any serious home cook. I did not pay close enough attention to the up close photos to see the handle is actually very thin aluminum. When it heats up during cooking it becomes pliable. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: kitchen widgets

customer_reviews.title: It's a spatula
customer_reviews.text: Flips burgers, salmon almost anything! Brilliant! It's a spatula. Does spatula things. Seems well made, no issues. Price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Agave

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: It seems a tad flimsy but overall very good- I bought this to use on a grill because the plastic one I had was melting.
customer_reviews.author: R. cohen

customer_reviews.title: MAYBE worth a dollar... maybe.
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was buying something cheap, for a single purpose... and this turner serves that purpose. But, if you have a $1 store close by go there... you will save money and get better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: A super nice set for the money. The quality is better than expected. The size of most of the items is HUGE!
customer_reviews.author: Dun Runnin

customer_reviews.title: Burger flipper
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Nothing special. Doesn't feel cheap. Seems to be dishwasher safe.. lol. Used for the grill
customer_reviews.author: A User

customer_reviews.title: Great and solid
customer_reviews.text: Great and solid, not a flimsy tool at all. I would also note for others who may care that it has a slightly right-handed angle to the tip, which is not seen in the picture. So, that's great for right handed folks, but if you're left handed, be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Emily S Huang

customer_reviews.title: A typical turner
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about a turner? It is just like any other turner that will do the job--flip what you are cooking, say, an egg. It is thin and seems durable. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Arkley XL

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great slotted spoon. That's the long and short story. Buy this. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy and works great. Easy to clean too. I've been using it with my new cast iron pan, and it's been working so great with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Nice additional utensil
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a thinner spatula and this one has worked great for all I have used it for. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: BMDavis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but nice for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: So it’s a cheap spatula. But it’s a nice cheap spatula. A little shorter than I’d like, it we will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A.

customer_reviews.title: Good spatula
customer_reviews.text: Great for taking cookies off the sheet. Could be kind of sharper to get under food, but it works well.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a while now. I wanted to use them before I wrote a review! I love these! They are sturdy, clean up beautifully & are well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: C.Wernli

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for in a spatula
customer_reviews.text: Finally got rid of my stained and lightweight spatula of many many years and purchased this. I am beyond happy with this product. Easy to hold, handle and wash. I expect that I won't need another one ever!
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine Schild

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality. The spoon is made from thin stamped sheet metal. The handle is made from hard shiny molded plastic. The spoon looks and feels really cheap. . . . . I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's not the plastic looking metal, this is heavy duty awesomeness. Like what SpongeBob has!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley&Braden ski

customer_reviews.title: It turns pancakes well
customer_reviews.text: All of my utinsels were not metal, i like cast iron pans. This filled the hole
customer_reviews.author: Techie customer

customer_reviews.title: Flipping great
customer_reviews.text: This is not for ceramic cookware but for cast iron it is excellent. Good balance and made well.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: It’s great but when we used it the first few times we realized it was too sharp and scratching our pans so we had to sand it down ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Harwood

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: It is longer than it seemed in the picture. Nothing wrong with it, I just thought it was going to be shorter, which is what I was wanting.
customer_reviews.author: jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Thin metal easily bends
customer_reviews.text: Don't plan on using these for any heavy lifting as thin metal bends easily.
customer_reviews.author: GO

customer_reviews.title: Great spatula
customer_reviews.text: Perfect spatula in every way. Not flimsy either. Good for the price too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Augustyniak

customer_reviews.title: Don't like angled head
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize that this spatula has an angled head -- my husband is left-handed, so he can't use this spatula at all. So just be aware. Other than that, it is an okay spatula -- nice and light weight, but not the type of utensil that is expected to last more than a few years.
customer_reviews.author: B. Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: perfect for cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for a spatula for my cast iron skillet. this was exactly what i was looking for - a strong, sturdy, stainless steel spatula.
customer_reviews.author: vh9

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction in the joint, connecting handle and stainless steel. I had this four months before the steel bent at the join while scraping an iron skillet. It might meet your needs if you don't use it to scrape your pans.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value, a little thinner that other stainless steel spatulas I own.
customer_reviews.author: The Man From Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Chef Craft 12510 Silver spatula!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my spatula of 40+ years and was looking for something sturdy and durable!! Needless to say this one fit the bill! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these consistently for about a month. Easy to clean, dishwasher doesn't tear them up, durable for heavy steaks. Will purchase again in the future if I ever need more.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money?  Dollar store item?
customer_reviews.text: don't waste your money. Very cheaply made. Spatula is fine, but handle is poorly made and unfinished (stainless steel edges on handle are not polished).
customer_reviews.author: Arleen Law

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight in your hand.
customer_reviews.text: This spatula is the perfect size and weight. So glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta A. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one and it has held up so well we bought 2 more to replace all of the plastic. These are sturdy, clean up perfectly and have been great over the last year.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great for heavier jobs on the cast iron and works for lighter jobs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: It’s good enough for my RV. Not anything really special, but it works fine
customer_reviews.author: mamajenn

customer_reviews.title: Great value spatulas
customer_reviews.text: These spatulas work just fine for my Blackstone griddle ,grill and cast iron skillets. Great value at $8 for 2. Sturdy and not flimsy. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gafleeman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: The front edge is slanted and not straight, and I've used aluminum foil more durable than the cheap, thin steel this thing is made out of. The shiny plastic handle seems like it would be slicker than cum on a gold tooth with the slightest bit of moisture. This thing is the perfect storm of crap. Spend the extra buck and buy something else. I wish I did.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hoelsher

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and lightweight but not too lightweight where it feels cheap
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Felish

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold much
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of the slotted spoon is good. However, the depth of the scoop of the spoon is very shallow and does not pick up much. Not being able to pick much up defeats the purpose of having it. I am still in the market for a deeper slotted spoon to get more out with every scoop. I was highly disappointed when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: MARK A. CAMERON

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Just got it the other day and it looks and feels good. seems to be very sturdy because it's made of stainless steel. Great for the the price
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Bit flimsy does the job
customer_reviews.text: Standard metal spatula As expected maybe a tiny bit flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Akitafun

customer_reviews.title: Flipping now
customer_reviews.text: Mom loves her new small grillcheese flipper. Merry Christmas she sure had flipping her sandwiches for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: william mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: I like this SS turner.
customer_reviews.text: A comfortable handle and quite sturdy. I've had it for a few weeks now and it words well.
customer_reviews.author: mark8too

customer_reviews.title: A bit small
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that the spatula was smaller than what I had expected. I didn't check the measurements before buying, but it's about 20% smaller than a regular spatula. Works well, just wee.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Bottiger

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It is "punch formed" makes it feel kind of weak. Not the best spatula i have bought but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Great utensil
customer_reviews.text: A good solid utensil, thin enough to get under food we've cooked or baked, sturdy enough to lift heavier food items.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had slightly higher sidewalls! Spills pizza sauce when you’re moving! But I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Vincens G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The handle fits comfortably in my hand and is made sturdy enough with some flex.
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: nice lil spatula
customer_reviews.text: This is the best spatula that I've ever had! It's so smooth and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: anna   f. godsey

customer_reviews.title: Just a normal cheaply made spatula
customer_reviews.text: Bends easily. Hard to clean if you do not rinse immediately. Otherwise, it cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Psyohe

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for a cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for the price i paid. However you can’t put pressure on it because it will bend it
customer_reviews.author: Alen Glina

customer_reviews.title: Great Spatula!
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great for the price! I use it for just about anything. I've used it for cookies, flipping steaks, scrambled eggs, etc. Super easy to clean and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D.

product_meta.title: Chef Craft Select Stainless Steel Turner/Spatula, (1-Pack), Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:TurnerThe Chef Craft Heavy Duty Select Stainless Steel Turner is very durable along with being dishwasher safe. The stainless steel construction is resistant to rust. It is constructed of a single sheet of stainless steel to lend durability while the ergonomic plastic handle is comfortable to use. The 13 inch length is the perfect distance to keep your hands away from heat while still providing control.
feature_bullets: Stainless steel construction prevents rust while a plastic handle provides comfort
13 Inch length provides enough distance from the pan to prevent getting burnt while also enough control to flip foods easily
Thin, angled edge slips under food easily when cooking for an optimized experience
Dishwasher safe provides quick and easy cleanup when cooking with any foods
Constructed without welding points to create strength and durability to the turner
